activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D. Tschannen

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen in court. Attorney Collin T Mettelka in court for Matthew D. Tschannen. Mettelka states still in discussions and investigations - would like to set out. Schiek has no objection. Bond continued. adj. 02:41 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No abusive contact with G.R.P. all other conditions remain

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen in court.  Attorney Collin T Mettelka appeared by video for Matthew D. Tschannen. Defendant waives right to counsels in person appearance. State calls Woodruff Police Chief Cory Backhaus/sworn/direct by Schiek/Witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Mettelka/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists and binds Defendant over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Mettelka willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 01:46 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen appeared in court, Attorney Collin T Mettelka appeared in court for Matthew D. Tschannen. Schiek states witness is not here - subpoena was set - would like an adjournment. Mettelka leaves up to the court discretion. Court states time limits were waived - not sure why witness is not here - will adjourn. Schiek statement to subpoena. Mettelka may appear by video and next appearance if Defendant agrees. Bond continued. adj. 11:09 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen appeared in court, Attorney Collin T Mettelka appeared in court for Matthew D. Tschannen. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 02:52 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 001864,
Payable Number: 105907,
Receipt Number: 22R 000926,
Amount: $20.00

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen appeared in court. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states has an initial meeting with an attorney next week. Court will set out. Bond continued. 01:21 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No direct contact with G.R.P. - may have electronic contact for parental purposes only/Not to possess any firearm/No intoxicants/No taverns - except for place of employment for work purposes only

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew D. Tschannen appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek/Defendant statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 01:42 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
